text: [Music]
how are there still footprints of
dinosaurs I mean it feels like they
would have washed away I don't I don't
understand you probably right that 90%
of old tracks that were made it'd wash
away but if you have just the right
consistency of the substrate the sand or
the mud that would take a very nice
impression and it could also dry out so
it becomes more like cement how do we
know when these marks were made dr. la
clay explains that paleontologists
primarily date fossilized markings like
the scratches by determining the age of
the rock on which the impression is left
that's often done with a process called
radiometric dating it's a method that
relies on elements found in the rock
over time each element will shed
neutrons and decay at a known rate that
scientists can measure to get an
approximate date for the rocks surface
but the key elements found in
sedimentary rock where fossils are
usually discovered decay too rapidly to
be a reliable dating source for such old
surfaces however there are elements that
exist in volcanic ash like uranium and
potassium which decay more slowly so
geologists will look for layers of ash
above and below the rock in which the
fossils are found by dating each layer
of ash they can determine an age range
for the rock and the fossils in question
you
